data.title: School closings and delays in Massachusetts for Monday, Jan. 29
data.meta_description: With snow falling overnight, particularly throughout the hilly regions of Central and Western Mass., some schools have already decided to cancel or delay school Monday.
data.text:
With snow falling overnight, particularly throughout the hilly regions of Central and Western Massachusetts, some schools have decided to close or delay the start of school Monday.

Some communities may wake up to 4 to 8 inches of snow on the ground Monday morning, the National Weather Service said Sunday.

The agency’s regional office in Norton issued a winter storm warning for some areas of the state Sunday morning, cautioning of heavy snow and difficult road travel into Monday.

Meteorologists were less certain of how much snow would accumulate at lower elevations, where temperatures were slightly warmer.

A winter weather advisory is in effect across the lower-altitude parts of the state, including communities east of Interstate 495, the Connecticut River Valley and areas closer to Connecticut and Rhode Island. In those regions, the weather service forecasted a combination of rain and snow Sunday, followed by a full transition to snow overnight and a slippery commute Monday morning.

More on education

West Springfield expands preschool options based on past success

Saugus school policy ‘impermissibly’ bars entry for migrant families, lawyers say

Emerson College lays off 10 staff members amid declining enrollment

Holyoke Community College is offering info sessions on new free community college program

A plan to return Holyoke Public Schools to local control to be unveiled Monday

For residents of Cape Cod and the South Coast, the storm is only expected to bring rain. But those areas may see a burst of snow showers on Monday as the storm wraps up elsewhere.

The following school districts have announced delays or closings for Monday, Jan. 29. This list is updated constantly. To refresh this list, click here.

*Note that schools are listed alphabetically by school name.*
